channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Republicans Should Get Rid of What’s Left of the Inflation Reduction Act
item.description: It’s good politics and good policy to eliminate as many of the act’s remaining environmentalist handouts as possible.

item.title: No, People Aren’t Being ‘Kidnapped’ or ‘Disappeared’
item.description: DHS is not a criminal enterprise.

item.title: GOP vows to stop lone activist judges from halting Trump agenda
item.description: Republicans are bashing a federal judge's ruling blocking the deportation of suspected gang members and say they are moving to ensure such an occurren...

item.title: Andy Beshear Doubles Down on Leftism to Prepare for 2028
item.description: If the moderate-seeming governor of red state Kentucky thinks veering left is the key to presidential victory, he should think again.

item.title: Yes, Recognize the Unique British Contribution to Slavery — Ending It
item.description: Activists want a permanent exhibit at the British Museum to commemorate the country’s role in the slave trade. They should get it, but not in the way ...

item.title: Overnight multimillionaire and Beast Games winner says MrBeast taught him when it’s okay to lose millions on your passion project
item.description: Despite Beast Games loosing “tens of millions” of dollars, the game’s $10 million winner says MrBeast’s dedication is inspiring.

item.title: Trump says auto tariffs are permanent and doesn’t care if they cause carmakers to hike prices — ‘I hope they raise their prices’
item.description: "I couldn’t care less. I hope they raise their prices, because if they do, people are gonna buy American-made cars. We have plenty," Trump said.

item.title: After the devastating LA wildfires, KB Home unveils a ‘fire-resilient’ community just outside San Diego—and a third of the homes have already sold
item.description: The homes have fire-rated roofs, noncombustible gutters, and buffer zones.

item.title: Gen Z are terrified of layoffs and the spiraling economy—so they’re copying Steve Jobs and showing up to the office in uniforms
item.description: After getting fired for dressing inappropriately, young workers are now ditching the crop tops and “office siren” looks in exchange for a Steve Jobs-s...

item.title: Who’s Really Twisting the Covid Record?
item.description: Some on the left accuse conservatives of rewriting coronavirus history. Figures such as Anthony Fauci have been doing so in full public view.

item.title: Trump appoints Sara Carter as next drug czar, says she 'will lead the charge to protect' US
item.description: President Donald Trump appointed Sara Carter as drug czar, saying she will "lead the charge to protect our nation and save our children from the scour...

item.title: Vaccine official resigns from FDA, criticizes Kennedy for promoting 'misinformation and lies'
item.description: The top vaccine official with the Food and Drug Administration has resigned and criticized the nation's top health official for allowing "misinformati...

item.title: Democrats’ Last-Resort Attack On WI Supreme Court Candidate Brad Schimel Is ‘Eff You!’
item.description: When Susan Crawford’s allies failed to get away with outright lies, they resorted to obnoxious obscenity.

item.title: Myanmar quake death toll rises to 1,644 as resistance movement announces partial ceasefire
item.description: The number of injured increased to 3,408, while the missing figure rose to 139.

item.title: At The Kennedy Center, Twyla Tharp Puts Art Above Politics
item.description: Twyla Tharp puts art above politics and keeps faith with her fans and her audience. We need more artists and performers to do the same.

item.title: Musk calls Walz 'a huge jerk' for cheering Tesla stock's crash
item.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk ripped Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz for the former vice presidential candidate's comments applauding the car giant's stock plummet.

item.description: A Global Day of Protest has been planned for Saturday, during which anti-Musk protesters plan to demonstrate at hundreds of Tesla showroom locations a...

item.title: US Naval Academy ends affirmative action in admissions: 'Implementing all directives'
item.description: The U.S. Naval Academy has changed policies related to affirmative action in admissions, following directives from President Donald Trump.

item.title: National Review Is Indistinguishable From A Leftist Rag On ‘Signal Gate’
item.description: The National Review has become what it once crusaded against — an outlet parroting leftist talking points.

item.title: Deporting Anti-American Foreigners Isn’t About Speech Rights. They Don’t Have The ‘Right’ To Be Here At All
item.description: No foreigner has the 'right' to be in America.

item.title: Book Review: Themes in Alternative Investments
item.description: This book highlights a cross-section of issues relevant to the current state of alternative investments.

item.title: Year of Shifting Sands: Reflections on the 2024 Global IPO Market
item.description: The dynamics of global capital flows are shifting. While the overall IPO market contracted last year, a closer look paints a more nuanced picture.

item.title: Book Review: Buffett’s Early Investments
item.description: This book digs into Buffett’s pre-Berkshire investments. The result is a fresh look into the origins of his investment approach.
